primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic struggle where Satan attempts to destroy the believer's faith through 'sifting', but is thwarted by the intercession of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus right here throws in heaven's mighty answer
He puts himself ever against Satan in our defense

object.identificatie: The preservation and restoration of the believer's faith/soul
tekstueel_bewijs: you will come out all right
The power of Satan is under the jurisdiction of our God
The decisions of Satan are appealable to a higher court
Simon, Simon, Satan has asked for you
I have come today armed with the authority to say to you
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of Christ's protection.

helper.identificatie: The Intercessory Prayer of Jesus / The Armor of God
tekstueel_bewijs: but I have prayed for you
Put on the whole armor of God
helper.rol_van_god: God (in Christ) is the primary Subject, but also the provider of the Helper (Armor).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help via the 'Sword of the Spirit'.

tekstueel_bewijs: a shrewd devil who is out to get us
Satan has desired to shake you violently
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as a strategist with 'endless resources of mind and plot' who operates in a 'murky region' beyond human accident.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the delivered believer to strengthen others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Restored Believer (Peter/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is strictly conditional on the success of the first: 'When you are delivered, help your brethren.'

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God (Judge) → Preservation of Faith → The Believer

voorbeelden_god_subject: The good Lord... takes our poor, clumsy efforts
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We wrestle not against flesh and blood
Miss church one Sunday and you feel less guilty

voorbeelden: we must ever be on the alert

blacks... will be wanting their rewards
It would help us to understand the danger

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God that overrules the 'Power' of Satan, providing the believer with the ability to stand despite their own lack of merit.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Satan's plan) to Niet-S1 (Human unworthiness) to S1 (Christ's prayer) and finally to Niet-S2 (The 'When' of deliverance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Higher Court' of God which limits the scope of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Satan is treated as a real, strategic, and cosmic threat.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains strong imperatives (Watch, Stand), they are grounded in the primary actantial work of Christ's intercession and God's sovereignty. The 'Subject' of the ultimate victory is God, not human willpower.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on church attendance as a metric of safety
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Miss church one Sunday and you feel less guilty, until it is easy to miss.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of acceptance despite poor performance
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the good Lord of us all takes our poor, clumsy efforts and accepts them so warmly.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christ's intercession as the decisive factor

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter is used as a model of vulnerability and restoration, and Jimmy Carter is used as a contemporary example of the 'best' being targeted.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already leans theocentric by focusing on what Jesus does for Peter rather than Peter's own strength.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance; the burden of cosmic defense is shifted to Christ.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic preservation: God keeps those He calls.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Danger' (Satan) to the 'Protection' (Christ) is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Hard fight' (Human effort) and 'God reigns' (Divine sovereignty).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The power of Satan is under the jurisdiction of our God.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Sword' for the fight.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is not just a mistake but a 'cunning adversary'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the primary Subject of the 'Protection' while acknowledging the hearer as the Subject of the 'Fight'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might feel they must 'Stand' by their own power in the Ephesians section.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the Armor is 'of God'—given, not manufactured by the soldier.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (Must) in the middle section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Balance with more Pouvoir (Can) derived from the Spirit.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'Standing' directly to the 'Praying' of Jesus.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already excels at taking the 'Opponent' seriously.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's prayer) clearly precedes and enables Ethics (Helping brethren).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a 'Grace-oriented' sermon that does not shy away from the reality of evil or the necessity of Christian vigilance.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'Plan' metaphor, semiotics reveals that the 'Plan' is an actantial strategy of the Opponent.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the meaning of 'sifting wheat'; semiotics focuses on the power-axis between Satan and Jesus.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'unworthiness' of the disciples is a modal lack of competence that only the Subject (Jesus) can rectify.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the political 'Plan' metaphor to establish the Savoir-faire (knowledge/strategy) of the Opponent.
